page.title: 17 Billen's Nursery;Wellow
page.content: In Wellow there are five nurseries.We chose Mr.Billen's nursery in Plaitford. To grow his products,shrubs,and climbing plants,acid type forest soil is used.The equipment consists of glasshouses,machinery and irrigation equipment.The Common Market does not affect the choice of product or income. The fertilizers used are sometimes chemical and sometimes organic.The over all production is whole sale, not retail, and is sold to the public and also garden centres.Twenty people are employed here,ten full time and ten part time.Pay varies from 125 to 255 pence per hour according to experience for part time. They work from 8.00a.m to 1.00p.m.,cutting and potting plants,whereas a full time worker would also care for and maintain the plants. He receives around 300 pence per hour. By J.Welsh.
